reviewTimeLines.summary: FPL-5378: B13-F04 Surface the ability to push the Delinquency Process from the Payment Position panel

comments.author: Paul Fitzgerald
comments.comment:
I wonder, when creating the tx, if we should set a boolean "txCreated" to true. And then instead of if (TransactionManager.getTransactionStackDepth() == 1) we check if(txCreated) to commit the transaction.
I'd be worried that if workspace/transaction already exists, we do not create one, but then we commit it after. But it would be expected to be committed elsewhere. Not sure if this could be the issue Bartek is seeing?

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment: Those tests shouldn't be on LeavePlanSearchServiceTest? Any particular reason for this?

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: You'll have to ask that to the class creator. I've just changed what was already there. I can only assume for its for the same reason that I've created another class to test the date related functionality. To test plan selection we need to actually persist all the entities into the database, which would only further complicate the current test. By separating the tests in differents classes we keep the test classes small enought to be understandable and we avoid creating a class with 10.000 line codes

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment: Considering there is only one test in this class, you could put @Ignore in the class instead of in the method, so the @before and @after could be ignored as well

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: Class was already set up that way. Didn't change the setup just the object being created.

comments.author: Daniel Dardis
comments.comment: The class name are not matching to the tested service, those tests shouldn't be on LeavePlanSearchServiceTest? Any particular reason for creating a new test class for testing getActiveLeavePlansWithAbsenceReasonUnderServiceAgreement?

comments.author: Filipe Rodrigues
comments.comment: Keep test classes as simple as possible. The scenarios to test this method are fairly complicated by separating them into different test classes we isolate the diferent scenarios keeping the tests simple and easy to understand and maintain.
